methods.name: ApiLevel
methods.description: API Level.

methods.name: ApplicationSpecificDirectory
methods.description: Returns the application specific directory you can use to write files without having WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission.

methods.name: Base64Encode
methods.description: Base64 encode a string. Precondition to use this block: Min Android Version of the app must be 8!

methods.name: ClearAppData
methods.description: Clear the app data of the current app. Returns true if clearing was successful, else false.

methods.name: ClearCache
methods.description: Clear the cache of the current app. Returns true if clearing was successful, else false.

methods.name: Density
methods.description: Returns the density of the device.

methods.name: DontKeepScreenOn
methods.description: Remove the KeepScreenOn flag.

methods.name: EmailAddressIsValid
methods.description: Returns true, if it is a valid email address, else false.

methods.name: GalleryRefresh
methods.description: Gallery Refresh for a specific filename.

methods.name: HideContent
methods.description: Hide content, i.e. enable content to move behind status and navigation bar.

methods.name: HideSystemUI
methods.description: Hide the system user interface

methods.name: HmacSha1
methods.description: Returns a base64 encoded HMAC SHA1 hash. Precondition to use this block: Min Android Version of the app must be 8!

methods.name: HmacSha256
methods.description: Returns a base64 encoded HMAC SHA256 hash. Precondition to use this block: Min Android Version of the app must be 8!

methods.name: IsDevelopment
methods.description: Returns true, if app is running in development mode (using the companion app), else returns false.

methods.name: KeepScreenOn
methods.description: As long as this window is visible to the user, keep the device's screen turned on and bright.

methods.name: Matches
methods.description: returns true, if string matches a regular expression, else false

methods.name: PackageName
methods.description: Returns the package name of the app.

methods.name: PathToAssets
methods.description: Returns the path to the assets. This method is useful, if you want to access files from the webviewer component stored in the assets of the app. The method will return 'file:///android_asset/' in case the app is running after building the app as apk file. For the companion app there can be returned 3 different values: file:///storage/emulated/0/Android/data/<packageName>/files/assets/ for devices >= Android 10, file:///storage/emulated/0/AppInventor/assets/' for the App Inventor companion app and < Android 10, file:///storage/emulated/0/Makeroid/assets/' for the Kodular (formerly Makeroid) companion app and < Android 10.

methods.name: SensorList
methods.description: Returns a list of available sensors

methods.name: Sha256
methods.description: Returns a Sha256 hash of a given string.

methods.name: ShowKeyboard
methods.description: Show the keyboard

methods.name: ShowSystemUI
methods.description: Show the system user interface

methods.name: VersionCode
methods.description: Returns the version code of the app

methods.name: VersionName
methods.description: Returns the version name of the app

methods.name: Xor
methods.description: Exclusive or for boolean: returns true only when inputs differ (one is true, the other is false).

methods.name: XorHex
methods.description: Exclusive or for hex strings, returns hex result. Strings must have the same length.

blockProperties.name: Country
blockProperties.description: Returns the country/region code of the current Locale, which should either be the empty string, an uppercase ISO 3166 2-letter code, or a UN M.49 3-digit code. A Locale object represents a specific geographical, political, or cultural region.

blockProperties.name: Language
blockProperties.description: Returns the language code of the current Locale. A Locale object represents a specific geographical, political, or cultural region.

blockProperties.name: NavigationBarColor
blockProperties.description: Set navigation bar color. This will work starting from API Level 21 (Android Lollipop

blockProperties.name: StatusBarColor
blockProperties.description: Set status bar color. This will work starting from API Level 21 (Android Lollipop

name: TaifunTools
helpString: A collection of several tools, which do not need additional permissions. Version 21a as of 2021-01-06.

events.name: ActivityStateChanged
events.description: Event indicating that the state of the activity changed.Possible values are pause, stop, resume. See also the activity lifecycle here http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Activity.html#ActivityLifecycle
